sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Vista Gold Corp. Announces Pricing of US$39.0 million Public Offering of Common Shares
feed.summary: Vista Gold Corp. announced the pricing of its underwritten public offering of 15,600,000 common shares at US$2.50 per share, aiming to raise US$39.0 million before deductions. The proceeds are intended to fund exploration and development at their Mt. Todd gold project in Australia and for general corporate purposes. The offering is expected to close on March 9, 2026, subject to customary conditions, with CIBC Capital Markets acting as the sole bookrunner.

feed.title: Where Food Comes From Inc Q4 revenue falls as some legacy customers cut back
feed.summary: Where Food Comes From Inc (WFCF) reported a decrease in its Q4 revenue. The decline is attributed to some of the company's long-standing customers reducing their services. This news highlights potential challenges for the company as it faces changes in client demand.

feed.title: VARONIS SYSTEMS, INC. (NASDAQ: VRNS) SHAREHOLDER ALERT
feed.summary: Bernstein Liebhard LLP has issued a shareholder alert for Varonis Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ: VRNS) investors regarding an upcoming deadline for a securities fraud class action lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges that Varonis made misrepresentations about its ability to convert existing customers to its SaaS offering, leading to reduced annual recurring revenue growth. Investors who purchased shares between February 4, 2025, and October 28, 2025, are encouraged to contact the firm.

feed.title: Calumet stock hits 52-week high at 29.93 USD
feed.summary: Calumet Specialty Products Partners (CLMT) stock reached a 52-week high of $29.93, trading just 1% below this peak with a market capitalization of $2.58 billion. The stock has surged 91.5% in the last 12 months, reflecting strong market performance, although InvestingPro data suggests it might be overvalued. The company recently completed a $405 million senior notes offering, extended its revolving credit facility, and its subsidiary, Montana Renewables, secured a three-year agreement to supply Sustainable Aviation Fuel.

feed.title: Leerink Maintains Outperform on Certara, Inc. (CERT) Feb 26 2026 PT $10
feed.summary: Leerink Partners maintained an Outperform rating on Certara, Inc. (CERT) but lowered its price target to $10 on February 26, 2026. This adjustment follows weaker bookings and lighter guidance in the latest quarter, though Leerink remains positive on the company's margins and free cash flow. The market reacted with a 4.63% price change, emphasizing investor sensitivity to Certara's near-term outlook.

feed.title: US DOE announces $26.5bn loan for Southern Company in Georgia and Alabama to support more than 16GW of power capacity
feed.summary: The US Department of Energy (DOE) has finalized a $26.5 billion loan to Southern Company's subsidiaries, Georgia Power and Alabama Power, marking the largest loan package in the DOE's history. This funding will support the development and upgrade of over 16GW of power capacity, including new gas generation, nuclear uprates, hydropower modernization, and transmission projects, across both states. The investment aims to enhance grid reliability and resilience, reduce energy costs, and accommodate significant data center growth in the region, with Southern Company projecting substantial contracted load growth for 2026.

feed.title: US Bancorp DE Sells 88,527 Shares of Verizon Communications Inc. $VZ
feed.summary: US Bancorp DE reduced its stake in Verizon Communications Inc. by 4.8% during the third quarter, divesting 88,527 shares and holding 1,769,161 shares worth $77.76 million. Other institutional investors like Vanguard Group Inc. and State Street Corp significantly increased their holdings in Verizon. The article also details recent analyst ratings, Verizon's financial performance, a dividend increase, and recent insider selling activity by a director and an EVP.

feed.title: PPL vs. FirstEnergy: Which Utility Is Positioned for Stronger Growth?
feed.summary: PPL Corporation and FirstEnergy are both appealing investment opportunities in the utility sector, driven by the expanding clean energy market and increasing electricity demand from data centers. Both companies are making significant strategic investments in grid infrastructure and clean energy generation to enhance reliability and support growth. While both show strong prospects, FirstEnergy is currently favored due to its improving earnings growth, higher ROE, better dividend yield, and superior recent price performance.

feed.title: US Bancorp DE Decreases Stock Holdings in Deere & Company $DE
feed.summary: US Bancorp DE reduced its stake in Deere & Company by 5.1% in the third quarter, holding 245,979 shares valued at $112.48 million. Despite this reduction, other institutional investors like Norges Bank, Marshall Wace LLP, and Vanguard Group Inc. significantly increased their positions. Deere & Company reported strong quarterly earnings, exceeding analyst estimates, and announced a quarterly dividend of $1.62 per share.

feed.title: Solventum (NYSE:SOLV) Given Buy Rating at BTIG Research
feed.summary: BTIG Research has reiterated a "buy" rating for Solventum (NYSE:SOLV), setting a price target of $100.00, suggesting a potential upside of 29.45%. This positive outlook follows Solventum's strong fourth-quarter earnings, where the company surpassed consensus estimates for both EPS and revenue, driven by robust demand in wound care and sterilization products. The company also announced a $1 billion stock buyback plan and issued optimistic FY 2026 guidance, reinforcing analyst confidence despite potential margin pressures.

feed.title: American Electric Power (NASDAQ:AEP) Upgraded at UBS Group
feed.summary: UBS Group has upgraded American Electric Power (NASDAQ:AEP) from a "sell" to a "neutral" rating, setting a $132.00 price target. This upgrade comes as AEP shows strong financial performance, beating analyst earnings expectations in its last quarterly report with $1.19 EPS compared to a $1.15 consensus. The company also saw significant institutional investment adjustments and reported insider stock sales over recent months.

feed.title: CAVA Group (NYSE:CAVA) Receives "Hold" Rating from Argus
feed.summary: Argus research analysts have reissued a "hold" rating for CAVA Group (NYSE:CAVA). This comes after several other firms like Johnson Rice, Citigroup, Sanford C. Bernstein, Mizuho, and Barclays adjusted their price targets and ratings. CAVA Group recently reported strong Q4 earnings, surpassing analyst estimates with $0.04 EPS and $274.99 million in revenue, leading to positive sentiment and multiple analyst upgrades, though some analysts maintain neutral ratings citing valuation concerns.

feed.title: Westpac Banking Corp Purchases 26,561 Shares of Devon Energy Corporation $DVN
feed.summary: Westpac Banking Corp significantly increased its stake in Devon Energy Corporation ($DVN) by 1,178.4% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 26,561 shares. This move brings their total holdings to 28,815 shares valued at $1,010,000. Other institutions also adjusted their positions, and a consensus of analysts rates DVN as a "Moderate Buy" with a target price of $47.37.

feed.title: Westpac Banking Corp Takes $736,000 Position in Western Digital Corporation $WDC

Ltd. and New York State Common Retirement Fund also increasing their stakes. feed.title: Westpac Banking Corp Acquires 4,202 Shares of Seagate Technology Holdings PLC $STX

Omnicom Group shares opened at $84.72 and the company announced a $5 billion stock buyback plan and a quarterly dividend of $0.80 per share.

Other institutional investors also adjusted their positions in Kenvue, while insider Jeffrey C. Smith acquired 3.2 million shares. Analysts have given Kenvue an average "Hold" rating with a consensus target price of $19.50.

feed.title: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP Acquires New Stake in Globe Life Inc. $GL
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP has acquired a new position in Globe Life Inc., purchasing 430,642 shares valued at approximately $61.57 million, representing 0.54% of the company. This comes as insiders have been net sellers, offloading shares worth $9.22 million over the past 90 days. Globe Life recently increased its quarterly dividend to $0.33 and provided FY2026 EPS guidance, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with a target price of $171.33.

feed.title: Westpac Banking Corp Has $265,000 Stock Holdings in Freeport-McMoRan Inc. $FCX
feed.summary: Westpac Banking Corp significantly decreased its stake in Freeport-McMoRan Inc. (NYSE:FCX) by 74.6% in the third quarter, reducing its holdings to 6,746 shares valued at $265,000. This comes as other institutional investors have adjusted their positions in the natural resource company, and company insiders have also engaged in substantial stock sales. Analysts generally maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Freeport-McMoRan, with a consensus target price of $60.73.

feed.title: Expedia Group, Inc. (EXPE) Gains as Harbor Mid Cap Value Fund Boosts Stake After Strong Results
feed.summary: Harbor Capital Advisors' Mid Cap Value Fund increased its stake in Expedia Group, Inc. (EXPE) during Q4 2025, following strong results and a raised outlook for the online travel services company. This move contributed to the Fund's outperformance, returning 4.07% against the Russell Midcap Value Index's 1.42%. Despite Expedia not being among the 30 most popular stocks for hedge funds, 70 hedge funds held EXPE in Q4 2025, up from 63 in the previous quarter.

feed.title: Earnings Flash (CGON) CG Oncology Posts 2025 Net Loss $2.08 a Share, vs. FactSet Est of $2.17 Loss
feed.summary: CG Oncology (CGON) announced a net loss of $2.08 per share for 2025, which is narrower than FactSet's estimated loss of $2.17 per share. This financial result was reported shortly after the company also posted its 2025 total revenue of $4 million, surpassing FactSet's estimate of $2.8 million. The company is actively developing a bladder-sparing therapeutic for bladder cancer, with its main candidate, cretostimogene, in various phases of clinical trials.

feed.title: Deutsche Bank Adjusts Host Hotels & Resorts PT to $27 From $26, Maintains Buy Rating
feed.summary: Deutsche Bank has increased its price target for Host Hotels & Resorts (HST) to $27 from $26, while reiterating a "Buy" rating on the stock. This adjustment reflects continued positive sentiment from analysts towards the specialized REIT. The news follows several other analyst adjustments for Host Hotels & Resorts in late February.

feed.title: CG Oncology Reports 2025 Year End Financial Results and Provides Business Updates
feed.summary: CG Oncology reported its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025, detailing increased R&D and G&A expenses and a net loss. The company also provided business updates, highlighting anticipated 2026 milestones including topline data from its Phase 3 PIVOT-006 trial for intermediate-risk NMIBC and first results from the CORE-008 Cohort CX trial, with cash reserves projected to fund operations into the first half of 2029. CG Oncology's focus remains on advancing cretostimogene as a potential backbone therapy for bladder cancer.

feed.title: Certara to Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
feed.summary: Certara, Inc. announced its participation in three upcoming investor conferences in March 2026: the TD Cowen 46th Annual Health Care Conference, the Leerink Global Healthcare Conference, and the Barclays 28th Annual Global Healthcare Conference. Management will present at these events, and live webcasts will be available on Certara's investor relations website. Certara specializes in biosimulation software and services for drug discovery and development.

feed.title: Important Notice to Long-Term Shareholders of Five9, Inc.
feed.summary: Grabar Law Office is investigating claims on behalf of long-term shareholders of Five9, Inc. (FIVN), Integer Holdings Corp. (ITGR), Kyndryl Holdings (KD), and Molina Healthcare, Inc. (MOH). The investigations stem from various alleged issues, including securities fraud class actions against Five9 and Integer, an SEC investigation into Kyndryl's cash management practices, and alleged undisclosed material adverse facts concerning Molina Healthcare's financial guidance. Shareholders who purchased shares before specified dates are encouraged to contact Grabar Law Office to learn about seeking corporate reforms and other remedies.

feed.title: Wells Fargo & Company $WFC Shares Bought by Westfield Capital Management Co. LP
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP significantly increased its stake in Wells Fargo & Company ($WFC) by 71.3% in the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 88,176 shares valued at $7.39 million. This move is part of broader institutional investor activity, which now accounts for approximately 75.9% of Wells Fargo's stock. The bank recently beat EPS estimates with $1.76 per share, declared a quarterly dividend of $0.45, and maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts, despite a recent insider share sale.

feed.title: 18,777 Shares in Waste Management, Inc. $WM Acquired by Westfield Capital Management Co. LP
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP has acquired a new stake of 18,777 shares in Waste Management, Inc. (NYSE:WM), valued at approximately $4.147 million, while other institutional investors also increased their positions, bringing total institutional ownership to 80.40%. Despite slightly missing Q3 earnings and revenue estimates, the company showed significant year-over-year revenue growth and strong returns on equity and net margin. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average price target of $253.55, with some firms raising price targets and reiterating positive ratings.

feed.title: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP Takes Position in Cardinal Health, Inc. $CAH
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP has acquired a new stake of 33,769 shares in Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE:CAH) during the third quarter, valued at approximately $5.3 million. Institutional investors now own about 87.17% of the company's stock, and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with a target price of $245.20. Cardinal Health recently surpassed its quarterly earnings expectations, reporting $2.63 EPS on $65.63 billion in revenue, and declared a quarterly dividend of $0.5107 per share.

feed.title: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP Has $5.91 Million Stock Holdings in Rollins, Inc. $ROL
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP significantly reduced its stake in Rollins, Inc. by 94.6% in Q3, selling over 1.7 million shares but retaining holdings valued at $5.91 million. The article also highlights recent insider selling activities totaling over 73,000 shares and a generally positive analyst outlook with a "Moderate Buy" rating and a consensus price target of $66.08 for Rollins despite a slight earnings miss. Rollins also announced a quarterly dividend of $0.1825 per share.

feed.title: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP Sells 2,785 Shares of Ameriprise Financial, Inc. $AMP
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP has reduced its stake in Ameriprise Financial, Inc. (NYSE:AMP) by 15.9%, selling 2,785 shares and now holding 14,691 shares valued at approximately $7.22 million. Other institutional investors have adjusted their positions, and corporate insiders have been net sellers in the last 90 days. Ameriprise Financial recently reported strong quarterly earnings, beating expectations, and announced a quarterly dividend of $1.60 per share while several analysts raised their price targets for the stock.

feed.title: 8,857 Shares in Casey's General Stores, Inc. $CASY Purchased by Thornburg Investment Management Inc.
feed.summary: Thornburg Investment Management Inc. recently acquired 8,857 shares in Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY) during the third quarter, a new position valued at approximately $5.01 million. This transaction highlights significant institutional interest, with institutional investors now owning about 85.63% of the company's stock. Analysts generally rate CASY as a "Moderate Buy" with an average price target of $621, despite mixed recent analyst notes, and the company recently beat its quarterly EPS estimates while offering a $0.57 quarterly dividend.

feed.title: Drug development firm Certara lines up three March investor talks
feed.summary: Certara (Nasdaq: CERT) announced its management will participate in three investor conferences in early March 2026: the TD Cowen 46th Annual Health Care Conference, the Leerink Global Healthcare Conference, and the Barclays 28th Annual Global Healthcare Conference. Live webcasts of these presentations will be available on Certara's investor relations website and will be accessible for replay for at least 90 days. The company, a global leader in model-informed drug development, aims to accelerate medicines through biosimulation software, technology, and services.

feed.title: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP Grows Stake in Williams Companies, Inc. (The) $WMB
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP significantly increased its stake in Williams Companies by 13.4% in Q3 2025, now holding over 201,000 shares worth $12.74 million. This move coincides with several analyst upgrades and raised price targets for WMB, resulting in a "Moderate Buy" consensus. The company also raised its quarterly dividend and provided a positive FY2026 EPS outlook, despite a slight Q4 2025 earnings per share miss.

feed.title: Forbes Recognizes Cintas as One of America’s Best Large Employers 2026
feed.summary: Cintas Corporation has been named one of Forbes’ America’s Best Large Employers for the fifth consecutive year, highlighting its commitment to fostering a positive workplace environment. The recognition is based on an independent survey of over 217,000 U.S. employees assessing aspects such as atmosphere, development, salary, company image, and culture. Cintas also received additional Forbes awards for 2026, including America’s Best Companies and America’s Best-in-State Companies.

feed.title: Targa Resources, Inc. $TRGP Stock Holdings Trimmed by Westfield Capital Management Co. LP
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP has reduced its stake in Targa Resources (NYSE:TRGP) by 4.5% in the third quarter, selling 8,643 shares, though institutional investors still own a significant 92.13% of the company. Targa Resources exceeded quarterly EPS estimates, announced a $1.00 quarterly dividend, and maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus analyst rating despite recent insider selling. The company has a market capitalization of $49.70 billion and a P/E ratio of 26.92.

feed.title: Calix, Inc $CALX Shares Purchased by Westfield Capital Management Co. LP
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP significantly increased its stake in Calix, Inc. by 135.0% in Q3, acquiring 392,947 additional shares, bringing its total to 684,096 shares valued at approximately $41.98 million. Calix also outperformed Q4 earnings estimates with $0.39 EPS and $272.4M revenue and authorized a $125 million share buyback, demonstrating a positive outlook from both institutional investors and the company's board. Analysts currently maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Calix with an average price target of $77.50.

(NASDAQ:SMCI), acquiring 359,439 shares valued at approximately $17.23 million, representing 0.06% of the company. The move comes as Super Micro exceeded Q-quarter earnings expectations and institutional ownership remains strong at 84.06%. NXP Semiconductors outperformed earnings expectations with an EPS of $3.35 and revenue of $3.34 billion, and currently holds a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating with an average price target of $253.67. The article also details other institutional investor activity, NXP's financial metrics, and recent analyst and insider transactions.

feed.title: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP Sells 16,106 Shares of J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. $JBHT

Hunt recently surpassed EPS estimates, raised its quarterly dividend, and holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts.

feed.title: Check Point Software Technologies Ltd. $CHKP Shares Sold by Westfield Capital Management Co. LP
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP significantly reduced its stake in Check Point Software Technologies Ltd. (NASDAQ:CHKP) by 85.3% in Q3, selling over half a million shares. This move leaves the firm with a holding valued at approximately $20.58 million. The report also highlights Check Point's recent earnings beat, revenue slightly below estimates, and trimmed price targets from several analysts, with a current consensus "Hold" rating.

feed.title: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP Sells 9,836 Shares of Fair Isaac Corporation $FICO
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP significantly reduced its stake in Fair Isaac Corporation (FICO) by 23.3%, selling 9,836 shares and maintaining 32,468 shares valued at approximately $48.59 million. This move comes as company insiders also offloaded shares, totaling over $4 million, though FICO recently exceeded quarterly earnings expectations and approved a $1.5 billion share buyback program. Analysts currently hold a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for Fair Isaac, with an average price target near $1,995.

feed.title: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP Reduces Stake in Diamondback Energy, Inc. $FANG
feed.summary: Westfield Capital Management Co. LP significantly reduced its stake in Diamondback Energy (NASDAQ:FANG) by 5.1% in Q3, now owning 319,664 shares valued at $45.74 million. This reduction comes as Diamondback Energy missed Q4 EPS and revenue estimates, though it did raise its quarterly dividend to $1.05. Despite insider selling, institutional ownership remains high at 90.01%, with a consensus "Buy" rating from analysts and a target price of $187.86.

feed.title: Dollar Tree Surged 70% Last Year, Is the Rally Over?
feed.summary: Dollar Tree's strategic transformation into a multi-price retailer contributed to a 64% return in 2025, attracting new households and improving financial metrics despite a recent downgrade by BMO Capital Markets. The company's Q3 FY2025 results showed strong growth, and its multi-price strategy is expected to drive profitability through 2028. Wall Street analysts generally hold a positive outlook, with a median price target close to its current trading price, positioning the upcoming Q4 earnings call as a critical point for validating its growth thesis.

feed.title: Public Service Enterprise Group Incorporated (NYSE:PEG) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) reported its Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings, with non-GAAP operating earnings of $0.72 per share for Q4 and $4.05 for the full year, exceeding expectations. The company also announced a 6% increase in its 2026 dividend to $2.68 per share and updated its long-term non-GAAP operating earnings CAGR to 6-8% through 2030, supported by robust regulated capital investments and strong operational performance across its utility and nuclear segments. PSEG discussed strategies for managing utility costs for customers, ongoing infrastructure modernization, and potential for growth through new generation opportunities in New Jersey.

feed.title: Synopsys, Inc. (NASDAQ:SNPS) Q1 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) reported strong Q1 2026 results, with revenue at the high end and non-GAAP EPS exceeding guidance, largely driven by the Ansys acquisition. The company is optimistic about its AI-driven design capabilities and the integration of Ansys, expecting long-term double-digit growth across its EDA, IP, and simulation segments. Despite some China headwinds and a transitional year for its IP business, Synopsys reiterated its full-year revenue and cash flow guidance while raising its non-GAAP EPS outlook.

feed.title: US Army awards contract to Textron for loitering munition
feed.summary: The US Army has awarded Textron Systems a prototype agreement for its Damocles loitering munition system under the Low Altitude Stalking & Strike Ordnance (LASSO) program. The Damocles system is a VTOL uncrewed aircraft system equipped with GEN2 Explosively Formed Penetrator (EFP) technology and features safety mechanisms to prevent unexploded ordnance. This contract positions loitering munitions as a key technology for warfighter protection, despite Textron's past controversial production of cluster bombs.

feed.title: Calix, Inc. Experiences Evaluation Revision Amid Mixed Technical Indicators and Market Performance
feed.summary: Calix, Inc., a small-cap company in the Telecom Equipment & Accessories sector, has undergone an evaluation revision due to mixed technical indicators. While the stock has seen a 34.81% annual return, outperforming the S&P 500, its three-year return is a mere 1.28% compared to the S&P 500's 69.39% surge. Technical trends present a complicated picture, with some indicators showing bearish trends weekly and others bullish monthly.

feed.title: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. (NASDAQ:CDRO) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Codere Online Luxembourg, S.A. reported strong Q4 2025 results with a record net gaming revenue of EUR 60 million and adjusted EBITDA of EUR 6.7 million, driven by growth in Mexico and Spain. The company met its 2025 guidance and provided an optimistic outlook for 2026, projecting NGR between EUR 235 million to EUR 245 million and adjusted EBITDA between EUR 15 million to EUR 20 million. Executives discussed strategic investments in Mexico ahead of the World Cup, efforts to optimize marketing efficiency, and the fluctuating regulatory environment in markets like Colombia.
